page.title: 18TWO CONTRASTING SCHOOLS 1
page.content: The{Travellers school}is for Gypsies. It is on a site in Oxney Road. The school is small and grey. 150 children attend the school during the year but 40 is the average daily attendance . The school has been open 10 years. Their ages are 3 to 17. The other schools the Travellers go to are{Newark Hill}and{Paston Ridings. There is just one teacher at the {Travellers school.}The most popular name is Debbie and John. The most common surname is Smith. 97% over 11 years old never go to school. The subjects they do are reading , writing, sums and craft.The school is open from 9 o'clock until 3.30. At the school they have a computer and they play chain games. 100,000 Travellers live in the U.K. The men do men's work collecting scrap metal,roofing, tarmac and agriculture. Women do ragging.
